snippet: While incomes of the lowest earners have stagnated, those of the wealthiest New Yorkers have soared, benefiting in part from the resurgence of the financial industry.
abstract: Census Bureau's American Community Survey points to widening income gap in Manhattan; study shows that gap there is widest in United States, with top 5 percent of households earning $864,394, or 88 times as much as poorest 20 percent.
lead_paragraph: While incomes of the lowest earners have stagnated, those of the wealthiest New Yorkers have soared, benefiting in part from the resurgence of the financial industry.

headline.main: Gap Between Manhattan’s Rich and Poor Is Greatest in U.S., Census Finds
headline.print_headline: Manhattan’s Income Gap Is Widest in U.S., Census Finds
